intro: Anthotroche blackii, commonly known as the black's anthotroche, is a species of flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae, which includes bellflowers and other similar genera. The plant is characterized by its tubular, bell-shaped flowers that are typically blue or violet in color. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its unique floral structure and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists alike.
